For my CS-164 I was tasked with creating a web program to simulate Charles Babbage's difference engine. Babbage's difference engine essentially allows one to compute high order degree derivatives with just addition. In order to buidl this I used a combination of technologies including Html, Css, Javascript, Angualr, Jquery, and Gulp. In order to compute the next order of differences I build a javascript function that uses a for loop and recursion to itereate through a user enFEtered amount of difference rows.


Upon first seeing the problem, I misinterpreted the problem by asuming I had to compute the differences via an equation and not by a first order difference. This led me to create a fucntion that first computes the first order differences via derivatives then goes onto to use a for loop to process the following orders of differences starting with 1. After realizing I overcomplicated the problem, I created function that would allow the user to choose whether they wanted to compute via equation or first order differences.


How To Use: My online difference engine simulator can compute differences from either an equation or first level difference orders. In order to use the simulator you first must choose what format you want to enter your data in. After choosing either an equation or a first order, you then must choose the amount of rows you want to compute. After checking the box to compute via an equation or unchecking the box to compute via a first order of differences, you clcik calculate. The results appear in the table below.
